_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Oasis Petroleum North America, LLC owns and operates upstream and midstream assets in over 506,000 net acres of the Williston Basin for the Bakken, Three Forks and other horizons. It is an independent exploration and production company focused on the acquisition and development of unconventional oil and natural gas resources from an integrated perspective. Companies such as Oasis Petroleum North America, LLC play a vital role in the global oil and gas industry as it is at the forefront of technology deployment, operational efficiencies, and infrastructure development.  Oasis Midstream Partners is the subsidiary of Oasis Petroleum North America, LLC and serves as a fundamental business and operating unit that takes natural gas and crude oil retrieved in the upstream sector to the downstream processing facilities.  Thus, supporting activities that take place after the initial production phase and through to the point of sale. 



Oasis Midstream Partners (OMP) operates the applicable facility titled the Rolfson S 5198 12-29 Central Tank Battery (Rolfson) in McKenzie County, North Dakota.  Rolfson's purpose primarily an upstream oil and gas extraction facility.  However, natural gas liquids (NGLs) are extracted from the field gas gathered from the nearby area of the Bakken Shale Formation at this location, as well. This extraction is done using Mechanical Refrigeration Unit (MRU) skids. The facility's location is approximately 5.3 miles north-northeast of Watford City in McKenzie County, North Dakota.



Rolfson is required to develop and implement a proper Risk Management Program (RMP) to mitigate risk under the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) regulation for Chemical Accident Release Prevention (40 CFR 68).  This requirement is fulfilled with the onset of the listed chemicals (as identified onsite) above their individual threshold quantities.  As a Program 1 Level facility, it has been determined that the site is subject to the regulation and the covered proce

sses will not affect the public in a worst-case release scenario.  As a newer facility, an off-site receptor has not been impacted by an accident in the previous five years as well. This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented, including:



    A description of our facility and use of substances regulated by EPA's RMP regulation

    An overview of our accidental release prevention policies and programs

    A five-year accident history for accidental releases of chemicals regulated by EPA's RMP rule

    An overview of our emergency response policies and program

    An overview of planned improvements at the facility to help prevent accidental chemical releases from occurring and adversely affecting our employees, the public, and the environment 

    A summary of results from our assessment of the potential offsite consequences from accidental chemical releases

    The certifications that EPA's RMP rule requires us to provide

    The detailed information (called data elements) about our risk management program



The health and safety of facility personnel along with the surrounding community is a top priority in the design, construction, and operation of the Rolfson facility. Furthermore, Oasis Petroleum North America, LLC strives to be a leader in environmental responsibility and is determined to make a positive impact on the community. It is our policy to comply with the safety, health, and environmental laws and regulations applicable to our business.  



Upon placing this facility into operation, the site will be a continuously manned operation with operations personnel onsite at all times. They will be supported by the Environmental, Health and Safety Department, the Regulatory Department, and the company as a whole. Our companies are committed to compliance regarding applicable industry standards, federal regulations, and State and l
